stories.title: Day in DIY Guns and Ammo

stories.text:
I started working in 2001 as a software engineer, but I can only list 10 years as my years of experience, since I count only the number of times I am employed. I have many side-projects, personal projects, apps in between, and skill/time wise I can easily bump my YoE. Though I might fail in many technical tests, but I can build you a product/app in 3 hours, do whatever you want to be build.

Now, I have been seeing resume that list more than 10 years, since they started in 2012 or so, jumping through various companies, but falls short of 10 years.

Finally, just want to be clear, what is a real definition of "Years of Experience"?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the real definition of “Years of Experience”?
